cell.color:
Although eucalyptus trees are abundant throughout Australia, their leaves are tough, low in nutrition, and contain oils that are poisonous to most animals. Few species eat eucalyptus; however, there is one animal that lives almost exclusively on the fragrant leaves: the
koala
. The koala's body is specially adapted to process the eucalyptus toxins, while the koala's sluggish metabolism helps compensate for the low nutrition value of eucalyptus.
Eucalyptus leaves can be placed directly on the ground, in a food dish, or in an elevated food dish.
